greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The periodic part of the decimal expansion of 1/n. Any initial 0's are to be placed at end of cycle.
comment: a(n) = n iff n = 3 or 6 (see De Koninck & Mercier reference). - _Bernard Schott_, Dec 02 2020
reference: Jean-Marie De Koninck & Armel Mercier, 1001 Problèmes en Théorie Classique des Nombres, Problème 347 pp. 50 and 205, Ellipses, Paris, 2004.
link: Philippe Guglielmetti, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1001 (first 500 terms from T. D. Noe)
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
maple: isCycl := proc(n) local ifa,i ; if n <= 2 then RETURN(false) ; fi ; ifa := ifactors(n)[2] ; for i from 1 to nops(ifa) do if op(1,op(i,ifa)) <> 2 and op(1,op(i,ifa)) <> 5 then RETURN(true) ; fi ; od ; RETURN(false) ; end: A036275 := proc(n) local ifa,sh,lpow,mpow,r ; if not isCycl(n) then RETURN(0) ; else lpow:=1 ; while true do for mpow from lpow-1 to 0 by -1 do if (10^lpow-10^mpow) mod n =0 then r := (10^lpow-10^mpow)/n ; r := r mod (10^(lpow-mpow)-1) ; while r*10 < 10^(lpow-mpow) do r := 10*r ; od ; RETURN(r) ; fi ; od ; lpow := lpow+1 ; od ; fi ; end: for n from 1 to 60 do printf("%d %d ",n,A036275(n)) ; od ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 19 2006
mathematica: Table[FromDigits[FindTransientRepeat[RealDigits[1/n,10,120][[1]],3] [[2]]],{n,40}] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 12 2019 *)
results.author: _Floor van Lamoen_
ext: Corrected and extended by _N. J. A. Sloane_
Corrected a(92), a(208), a(248), a(328), a(352) and a(488) which missed a trailing zero (see the table). - _Philippe Guglielmetti_, Jun 20 2017
